https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

description: The Google Data Loss Prevention API provides methods for detection of privacy-sensitive fragments in text, images, and Google Cloud Platform storage repositories.
name: dlp

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

inspect.description:
Find potentially sensitive info in a list of strings.
This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size.

redact.description:
Redact potentially sensitive info from a list of strings.
This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size.

list.description: Returns the list of root categories of sensitive information.

languageCode.description:
Optional language code for localized friendly category names.
If omitted or if localized strings are not available,
en-US strings will be returned.

list.description: Returns sensitive information types for given category.

languageCode.description:
Optional BCP-47 language code for localized info type friendly
names. If omitted, or if localized strings are not available,
en-US strings will be returned.

category.description: Category name as returned by ListRootCategories.

list.description: Returns list of results for given inspect operation result set id.

name.description:
Identifier of the results set returned as metadata of
the longrunning operation created by a call to CreateInspectOperation.
Should be in the format of `inspect/results/{id}.

pageToken.description:
The value returned by the last `ListInspectFindingsResponse`; indicates
that this is a continuation of a prior `ListInspectFindings` call, and that
the system should return the next page of data.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of results to return.
If 0, the implementation will select a reasonable value.

cancel.description: Cancels an operation. Use the get method to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation.

name.description: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

delete.description: This method is not supported and the server returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.

name.description: The name of the operation resource to be deleted.

list.description:
Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the
server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.

NOTE: the `name` binding below allows API services to override the binding
to use different resource name schemes, such as `users/*/operations`.

pageSize.description: The list page size. The max allowed value is 256 and default is 100.

filter.description: This parameter supports filtering by done, ie done=true or done=false.

name.description: The name of the operation collection.

get.description:
Gets the latest state of a long-running operation.  Clients can use this
method to poll the operation result at intervals as recommended by the API
service.

name.description: The name of the operation resource.

create.description: Schedule a job scanning content in a Google Cloud Platform data repository.

displayName.description: Human readable form of the category name.

Operation.description:
This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a
network API call.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

response.description: This field will contain an `InspectOperationResult` object.

name.description: The server-assigned name, The `name` should have the format of `inspect/operations/<identifier>`.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

metadata.description: This field will contain an `InspectOperationMetdata` object.

CloudStorageOptions.description:
Options defining a file or a set of files (path ending with *) within
a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

PathElement.description:
A (kind, ID/name) pair used to construct a key path.

If either name or ID is set, the element is complete.
If neither is set, the element is incomplete.

name.description:
The name of the entity.
A name matching regex `__.*__` is reserved/read-only.
A name must not be more than 1500 bytes when UTF-8 encoded.
Cannot be `""`.

kind.description:
The kind of the entity.
A kind matching regex `__.*__` is reserved/read-only.
A kind must not contain more than 1500 bytes when UTF-8 encoded.
Cannot be `""`.

id.description:
The auto-allocated ID of the entity.
Never equal to zero. Values less than zero are discouraged and may not
be supported in the future.

InspectResult.description: All the findings for a single scanned item.

findings.description: List of findings for an item.

findingsTruncated.description:
If true, then this item might have more findings than were returned,
and the findings returned are an arbitrary subset of all findings.
The findings list might be truncated because the input items were too
large, or because the server reached the maximum amount of resources
allowed for a single API call. For best results, divide the input into
smaller batches.

Status.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different
programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by
[gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). The error model is designed to be:

- Simple to use and understand for most users
- Flexible enough to meet unexpected needs

# Overview

The `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message,
and error details. The error code should be an enum value of
google.rpc.Code, but it may accept additional error codes if needed.  The
error message should be a developer-facing English message that helps
developers *understand* and *resolve* the error. If a localized user-facing
error message is needed, put the localized message in the error details or
localize it in the client. The optional error details may contain arbitrary
information about the error. There is a predefined set of error detail types
in the package `google.rpc` which can be used for common error conditions.

# Language mapping

The `Status` message is the logical representation of the error model, but it
is not necessarily the actual wire format. When the `Status` message is
exposed in different client libraries and different wire protocols, it can be
mapped differently. For example, it will likely be mapped to some exceptions
in Java, but more likely mapped to some error codes in C.

# Other uses

The error model and the `Status` message can be used in a variety of
environments, either with or without APIs, to provide a
consistent developer experience across different environments.

Example uses of this error model include:

- Partial errors. If a service needs to return partial errors to the client,
    it may embed the `Status` in the normal response to indicate the partial
    errors.

- Workflow errors. A typical workflow has multiple steps. Each step may
    have a `Status` message for error reporting purpose.

- Batch operations. If a client uses batch request and batch response, the
    `Status` message should be used directly inside batch response, one for
    each error sub-response.

- Asynchronous operations. If an API call embeds asynchronous operation
    results in its response, the status of those operations should be
    represented directly using the `Status` message.

- Logging. If some API errors are stored in logs, the message `Status` could
    be used directly after any stripping needed for security/privacy reasons.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There will be a
common set of message types for APIs to use.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

RedactContentResponse.description: Results of deidentifying a list of items.

start.description: Index of the first character of the range (inclusive).

end.description: Index of the last character of the range (exclusive).

FieldId.description: General identifier of a data field in a storage service.

KindExpression.description: A representation of a Datastore kind.

infoTypes.description: Set of sensitive info types belonging to a category.

Key.description:
A unique identifier for a Datastore entity.
If a key's partition ID or any of its path kinds or names are
reserved/read-only, the key is reserved/read-only.
A reserved/read-only key is forbidden in certain documented contexts.

partitionId.description:
Entities are partitioned into subsets, currently identified by a project
ID and namespace ID.
Queries are scoped to a single partition.

path.description:
The entity path.
An entity path consists of one or more elements composed of a kind and a
string or numerical identifier, which identify entities. The first
element identifies a _root entity_, the second element identifies
a _child_ of the root entity, the third element identifies a child of the
second entity, and so forth. The entities identified by all prefixes of
the path are called the element's _ancestors_.

A path can never be empty, and a path can have at most 100 elements.

operations.description: A list of operations that matches the specified filter in the request.

InspectContentRequest.description: Request to search for potentially sensitive info in a list of items.

items.description:
The list of items to inspect. Items in a single request are
considered "related" unless inspect_config.independent_inputs is true.
Up to 100 are allowed per request.

PropertyReference.description: A reference to a property relative to the Datastore kind expressions.

name.description:
The name of the property.
If name includes "."s, it may be interpreted as a property name path.

Projection.description: A representation of a Datastore property in a projection.

displayName.description: Human readable form of the info type name.

categories.description: List of categories this info type belongs to.

name.description: Internal name of the info type.

ImageLocation.description: Bounding box encompassing detected text within an image.

height.description: Height of the bounding box in pixels.

top.description: Top coordinate of the bounding box. (0,0) is upper left.

left.description: Left coordinate of the bounding box. (0,0) is upper left.

width.description: Width of the bounding box in pixels.

CloudStorageKey.description: Record key for a finding in a Cloud Storage file.

startOffset.description: Byte offset of the referenced data in the file.

DatastoreOptions.description: Options defining a data set within Google Cloud Datastore.

partitionId.description:
A partition ID identifies a grouping of entities. The grouping is always
by project and namespace, however the namespace ID may be empty.

projection.description:
Properties to scan. If none are specified, all properties will be scanned
by default.

categories.description: List of all into type categories supported by the API.

DatastoreKey.description: Record key for a finding in Cloud Datastore.

Location.description: Specifies the location of a finding within its source item.

codepointRange.description:
Character offsets within a content item, included when content type
is a text. Default charset assumed to be UTF-8.

fieldId.description: Field id of the field containing the finding.

byteRange.description: Zero-based byte offsets within a content item.

nextPageToken.description:
If not empty, indicates that there may be more results that match the
request; this value should be passed in a new `ListInspectFindingsRequest`.

RecordKey.description: Message for a unique key indicating a record that contains a finding.

ContentItem.description: Container structure for the content to inspect.

type.description:
Type of the content, as defined in Content-Type HTTP header.
Supported types are: all "text" types, octet streams, PNG images,
JPEG images.

value.description: String data to inspect or redact.

data.description: Content data to inspect or redact.

InspectContentResponse.description: Results of inspecting a list of items.

results.description:
Each content_item from the request will have a result in this list, in the
same order as the request.

CreateInspectOperationRequest.description:
Request for scheduling a scan of a data subset from a Google Platform data
repository.

storageConfig.description: Specification of the data set to process.

Finding.description: Container structure describing a single finding within a string or image.

infoType.description: The specific type of info the string might be.

quote.description: The specific string that may be potentially sensitive info.

likelihood.description: Estimate of how likely it is that the info_type is correct.
enumDescriptions: Default value; information with all likelihoods will be included.

InspectConfig.description:
Configuration description of the scanning process.
When used with redactContent only info_types and min_likelihood are currently
used.

infoTypes.description:
Restrict what info_types to look for. The values must correspond to
InfoType values returned by ListInfoTypes or found in documentation.
Empty info_types runs all enabled detectors.

excludeTypes.description: When true, exclude type information of the findings.

includeQuote.description:
When true, a contextual quote from the data that triggered a finding will
be included in the response; see Finding.quote.

minLikelihood.description: Only return findings equal or above this threshold.
enumDescriptions: Default value; information with all likelihoods will be included.

maxFindings.description: Limit the number of findings per content item.

InfoType.description: Type of information detected by the API.

name.description: Name of the information type, provided by the API call ListInfoTypes.

infoType.description:
Type of information to replace. Only one ReplaceConfig per info_type
should be provided. If ReplaceConfig does not have an info_type, we'll
match it against all info_types that are found but not specified in
another ReplaceConfig.

replaceWith.description: Content replacing sensitive information of given type. Max 256 chars.

url.description:
The url, in the format gs://<bucket>/<path>. Trailing wildcard in the
path is allowed.

StorageConfig.description: Shared message indicating Cloud storage type.

RedactContentRequest.description:
Request to search for potentially sensitive info in a list of items
and replace it with a default or provided content.

items.description: The list of items to inspect. Up to 100 are allowed per request.

replaceConfigs.description: The strings to replace findings with. Must specify at least one.

PartitionId.description:
Datastore partition ID.
A partition ID identifies a grouping of entities. The grouping is always
by project and namespace, however the namespace ID may be empty.

A partition ID contains several dimensions:
project ID and namespace ID.

databaseId.description:
If not empty, the ID of the database to which the entities
belong.

namespaceId.description: If not empty, the ID of the namespace to which the entities belong.

projectId.description: The ID of the project to which the entities belong.

title: DLP API
